definition: goose feather snow (idiom)/big heavy snow fall

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean

sentences.english: School lin the afternoon, the snow is next, and turned to snow.

sentences.chinese: 天開始下起了鵝毛大雪。

sentences.english: It began to snow big, far flakes.
sentences.chinese: 鵝毛大雪開始紛紛飄落。

sentences.english: Is a beginning to meet Li Li the goose hair that night heavy snow?
sentences.chinese: 是初遇莉莉那晚的鵝毛大雪麼？
